abstract: California's Air Resources Board approves cut to carbon pollution from gasoline and diesel fuels that will force oil producers to reduce amount of amount of carbon from transportation fuels 10 percent by 2020; approval, coming after rejection of Gov Jerry Brown's plan to drastically cut state's petroleum use by 2030, signals state's determination to aggressively push environmental measures through regulatory process rather than legislation.
lead_paragraph: The action signaled the determination of the administration of Gov. Jerry Brown to press forward with an aggressive environmental agenda through the regulatory process rather than by legislation.

headline.main: California Board Backs New Limits on Carbon From Gas and Diesel
headline.print_headline: California Board Backs New Limits on Carbon From Gas and Diesel

snippet: The action signaled the determination of the administration of Gov. Jerry Brown to press forward with an aggressive environmental agenda through the regulatory process rather than by legislation.
